id: 123
text: s a closed system in that it does not include demography (births, non-COVID-19 deaths) or migration. It partitions the population in 11 mutually exclusive and exhaustive compartments (Figure 1(a)): • Susceptible (S): People who are susceptible to SARS-CoV-2 infection. • Exposed (E): Early-infected persons who are not yet contagious and are in the incubation period. • Infected (I): People currently infected and contagious. • Undetected (UR and (UD): Infected people who are not detected (and are not counted among the known cases) because they did not get tested. It is assumed that these compartments do not contribute to the infection process because the corresponding persons develop symptoms and are then self-quarantined. Some will die Downloaded from informs
